name: Anne van Tol
summary:
Fascinated by English, connected to Dutch and lover of literature.

After finishing my bachelor's degree in English Literature and Society I decided to start a master's degree in Literary Translation. This degree allows me to combine my interest in literature with studying translation as a practical skill. After graduation I hope to ignite an enthusiasm for language and books in readers of translated works.

summary:
With a Bachelor’s degree in English Language and Culture and a year abroad as an Exchange student in the UK,  I have been able to receive a broad education in various abilities and skills. Additionally, my internship at the National Library of the Netherlands, have given me stronger skills in communication, organization, and time management. 

Last, but most certainly not least, my year as an Azure Cloud trainee has taught me the importance of continuously learning and improving my skills and knowledge in order to keep up with fast changing IT landscape.  

Any lack of experience I have is compensated by my drive to learn and improve my abilities.

name: Karl Webster
degree 2: CELTA (Certificate of Teaching the English Language to Adults)
summary:
I'm a writer. 

For 30 years I wrote everything, and anything, whatever washed up on my aimless path - not even a path. More of a ruddlerless jazz-type voyage from one pit-bull of an idea to the next. These are some of the things that I wrote…

* features, interviews, news stuff, funny stuff, for a whole motley variety of magazines and websites
* Radio 4 comedy scripts
* book reviews, film reviews, toaster reviews, sex toy reviews
* dictionary definitions
* a poem about an alcoholic superfish
* a couple of suitably ironic songs about Jesus
* an online business English course for Italians
* a whole e-learning platform ... thing. I don’t know. It was a long time ago.
* a guide book for a virtual world
* a long-standing faux online identity (faux is a very nice word. Sounds sweet. Sexy almost. Much better than fake.) 
* translations for an Italian toiletries manufacturer

I also edited books and newsletters and I worked as a sub-editor for a while. Oh, and taught English for twenty years. And wrote four novels. All the while drifting like a feather. In a beautiful world. 

But as of March 2016, all that has changed. For in March 2016, I found focus. 

Now I'm catching up with the world and going online. Full immersion. Making a living from the skills I've accidentally built up over the past 30 years. Digital nomad. All that. How nomadic I'll be remains to be seen. How much of a living I'll make remains to be seen. But I've started. And I'm focused. 

What I'm doing on LinkedIn I have no idea. It just ground me down in the end. Like a bird pecking at your scalp for ten whole years. OK, OK. I'm in. Now what do you need?
